ARABIC: فَمَا بَكَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُنظَرِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Neither heaven nor earth shed any tears for them and they were granted no reprieve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Neither did the heavens weep for them, nor the earth, nor were they granted respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then neither the sky shed tears over them nor the earth. They were granted no respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The sky nor the earth cried for them, nor were they given respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So the heavens and the earth did not weep for them, and they were not given respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And the heavens and the earth wept not for them, nor were they given respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So the heaven and the earth did not weep for them, nor were they respited.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Neither heaven nor earth wept for them, nor were they respited;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the heaven and the earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Neither heaven nor earth wept for them, nor were they allowed any respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the heavens and the earth wept not over them, nor were they respited.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So neither the sky wept for them, nor the earth; nor were they granted any respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And neither heaven nor earth shed a tear over them: nor were they given a respite (again).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And the heavens and the earth wept not for them, nor were they given a respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Neither heaven nor earth shed tears for them; nor were they respited,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Neither heaven nor earth wept over them, nor were they reprieved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the heaven and earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:29] So neither the heaven nor the earth wept for them — in contrast to the [case with] believers, at the point of whose death weep both their places of prayer on earth and the route by which their deeds ascend the heaven; nor were they reprieved, [nor] were they deferred [until they were able] to make repentance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the heaven) the gate of heaven (and the earth) and the place of prayer on earth (wept not for them) for Pharaoh and his folk; this is because when the believer dies the gate of heaven from which his works ascends, and the place wherein he used to pray on earth, will weep for him; Pharaoh and his folk did not have any good works to ascend to heaven nor any place of prayer on earth, (nor were they reprieved) from drowning.
